Installing BaseITS¶

Installation Overview¶

BaseITS is written in Python and supports Python 3.6+. It requires several Python libraries including numpy, pandas, multiprocessing, statsmodels, scit-learn, feature-engine, seaborn, and matplotlib, all of which are installed when BaseITS is installed.

Installing BaseITS from Source¶

You can install BaseITS from the IBM Enterprise Git Repository using SSH. This can be done by installing directly via git or by cloning the repo and installing locally.

$ pip3 install git+ssh://git@github.ibm.com/AfricaHealthcare/BaseITS.git

$ git clone git+ssh://git@github.ibm.com/AfricaHealthcare/BaseITS.git
$ cd BaseITS
$ pip3 install .

You can also install BaseITS from the IBM Enterprise Git Repository using HTTPS URLs via the terminal. Note that this requires a personal access token. If you do not have one, follow the instructions for creating a personal access token.

$ pip3 install git+https://token@github.ibm.com/AfricaHealthcare/BaseITS.git

Installing BaseITS Docker Images¶

BaseITS can also be installed and run from Docker Containers registered in an IBM Container Registry. To use this method, you must have access to an IBM Cloud account and the resource group where the BaseITS Docker Image has been registered.

  1. Make sure you can access an IBM Cloud account and the IBM Cloud resource group where the BaseITS Image has been registered. For example, the image has been registered in the ‘286900-RIS’ account under the ‘IBM Research Kenya Healthcare’ resource group. If you do not have access to the account and/or resource group, please contact your IT administrator.

  2. Make sure you have your personal API Key for an IBM Cloud account where BaseITS Docker image is registered. If you do not have an API Key, see Creating an IBM Cloud API key.

  3. Access and download the BaseITS Docker Image Installation script. Note that this is only required when running for the first time.

    1. Run the following URL on your web browser to access the dpoc library installation script.

    2. Click the ‘Raw’ button in the menu at the top right of the script.

    3. Right click your mouse and select ‘Save As’.

    4. Add the extension ‘.sh’ on the filename ‘run_dpoc_docker_image’ if it is not there. Note that if you are a Windows user, you will need to change the ‘Save as type’ to ‘All files’.

    5. Click on ‘Save’ to download the installation file.

  4. Install all external dependencies. Note that this is only required when running for the first time.

    Unix & Linux Users

    1. Ensure that Docker is installed in your machine. If Docker is not installed, see Get Docker.

    2. Open a terminal window and run docker -v to confirm that that Docker was successfully installed.

    Windows Users

    1. Open Windows PowerShell by right-clicking and select “Run as Administrator”.

    2. Run the command below to install the IBM Cloud Developer Tools in your machine. This will install Git and Docker if they are not already installed. Note that IBM Cloud Developer Tools support Windows 10 or newer. For more information, see IBM Cloud Developer Tools.

    Set-ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted; iex(New-Object Net.WebClient).DownloadString('https://ibm.biz/idt-win-installer')

    1. Follow the steps and when asked about ‘Execution Policy Change’ enter ‘A’ for ‘Yes to All’.

    2. When asked whether to install Docker, please install it by following the prompts. You might be required to restart your machine. Each time it restarts, start from step ‘4a’ again.

    3. If after installing Docker and restarting you get an error popup that docker failed to start, see ‘Step 4 - Download the Linux kernel update package’ in the Manual installation steps for older versions of WSL.

    4. When asked to install git, please install by following the instructions. Use the default installation instructions. You might be required to restart your machine. Each time it restarts, kindly start from step ‘4a’ above again.

  5. Run the installation file.

    1. Run the ‘run_dpoc_docker_image.sh’ file to start using dpoc library.

      Unix, Linux, & Windows Git Bash Users

      Switch to the directory having the ‘run_dpoc_docker_image.sh’ file and execute the command below

      $ sh ./run_dpoc_docker_image.sh

      Windows Users

      Double click on the run_dpoc_docker_image.sh file to start running it. Note that Git Bash must have been installed already.

    2. If you are running the script for the first time, you will be asked to enter the parameters listed below.

      • The IBM Cloud region (e.g. eu-gb)

      • The IBM Cloud Resource Group (e.g. IBM Research Kenya Healthcare)

      • The IBM Container Registry URL for the BaseITS Docker image (e.g. uk.icr.io)

      • The IBM Container Registry Namespace for the BaseITS Docker image (e.g. dpoc)

      • The IBM Container Registry Image name/Repository name for the BaseITS Docker image(e.g. dpoc)

      • The IBM Container Registry Image Version (Tag) for the BaseITS Docker image(e.g. latest, v1.0.0)

      • Your IBM Cloud Account ApiKey (see step 2 above)

      Note that you can press enter to use the default values for parameters except for your IBM Cloud Account ApiKey. Also note that, you may need to contact your BaseITS IT administrator for the right parameter values in case the default values do not work.

  6. If the installation was successfully, a Jupyter notebook link with a unique token is created (see example below). You can copy the link and run it in your web browser.

http://127.0.0.1:8889/?token=678666ca8ee3a1e28cc5f9e1ef271e74888fd9958368aadc

Uninstalling BaseITS¶

You can uninstall BaseITS using the following command.

$ pip3 uninstall dpoc

Getting Installation Help¶

For any questions or assistance about installing BaseITS, please send your message to the BaseITS-Help Slack channel.
